New Records: Antonín Barák became the first Czech Republic player sent off at the European Championship since 2000, with the earliest dismissal in tournament history. Hakan Çalhanoglu made the joint-most European Championship appearances for a Turkish outfield player (8), alongside Hakan Balta.
Key Match Events: Antonín Barák received a red card after 19 minutes and 28 seconds, the earliest in the tournament's history. Cenk Tosun scored a stoppage-time goal to secure Turkey's victory. The match saw 18 cards shown, the most in a single game at the European Championship.
Post-Match Reflections: Czech Republic were eliminated, while Turkey advanced to the knockout stages. Antonín Barák's dismissal and the high number of cards highlighted the intense nature of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Arda Güler and Kenan Yildiz started for Turkey, with Yildiz contributing six shots. Tomás Soucek scored for Czech Republic, becoming one of four goalscorers in the tournament for his team. The match saw substitutions and challenges that affected play.
Others: The Opta match center provided detailed stats and analysis of the game, including team and player performances.
